summary: This document is a court filing from the Co-Executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, requesting a ruling on an expedited motion to establish a voluntary claims resolution program for sexual abuse victims. It includes an attached transcript from a November 21, 2019, status conference in New York federal court where Magistrate Judge Debra C. Freeman urged settlement discussions and coordination with the proposed program.

events.title: Filing of Expedited Motion for Claims Program
events.description: The Co-Executors of Epstein's estate filed a motion in the Virgin Islands probate court seeking approval to establish a voluntary claims resolution program for sexual abuse victims.

events.title: Status Conference in New York Federal Court
events.description: Magistrate Judge Debra C. Freeman held a conference for multiple lawsuits against the Epstein estate, urging parties to explore settlement through the proposed compensation program and directing a status report by January 10, 2020.

events.title: Claimant's Response to Motion
events.description: An unnamed claimant filed a response stating no objection to a voluntary program for victims but objecting to funding it through estate assets until all claims are resolved.

events.title: Request for Ruling on Expedited Motion
events.description: The Co-Executors' attorneys filed this document formally requesting the Virgin Islands probate court to rule on the November 14 motion, citing urgency and the growing number of lawsuits.

locations: Superior Court of the Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas & St. John
500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: As of December 2019, there were 17 lawsuits pending against the Epstein estate involving allegations by 26 different plaintiffs of sexual abuse.
Plaintiffs' attorney Bradley J. Edwards stated that "potentially dozens" more lawsuits were expected to be filed.
The proposed Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was designed as a mass tort-type settlement mechanism to resolve claims outside of protracted litigation.
Magistrate Judge Debra C. Freeman ordered all parties to file a status report on settlement progress, including via the proposed program, by January 10, 2020.
The Co-Executors argued that delay in approving the program would cause prejudice to both claimants and the estate due to mounting legal costs.
